author: adityapatwardhan
body:
Debug assert while running console tests.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell

Start-PSBuild -Clean
Start-DevPowerShell
<repo root>\test\powershell\Host\ConsoleHost.Tests.ps1

```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Tests pass


Actual behavior
---------------

FailFast: array argument and ArrayLiteralAst differ in number of elements

   at System.Diagnostics.Debug.Assert(Boolean condition, String message, String detailMessage)
   at System.Management.Automation.Diagnostics.Assert(Boolean condition, String whyThisShouldNeverHappen, String detailMessage) in D:\OpenPowershell\aditya\PowerShell\src\System.Management.Automation\utils\assert.cs:line 196

comments.author: dantraMSFT
comments.body:
This can be repro'd by executing the test step directly from a debug build of pwsh.

```
$powershell = ".\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.0\win7-x64\publish\pwsh"
$powershell -noprofile { $args[0] } -args 1,(2,3)
```

The assert is occurring in the launching the PowerShell process.

The Diagnostics.Assert statement in `NativeCommandParameterBinder.cs` is not a valid assert for the `encodedarguments` parameter.  For that case, `argArrayAst` is not null but the parameter value is an encoded string, not the value array itself. 
NOTE: I have not confirmed that this is the only issue.

See PR https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/5301 for the change in `NativeCommandParameterBinder.cs`

title: Debug assert "array argument and ArrayLiteralAst differ in number of elements" while running ConsoleHost tests
